column1: 1) Covid is real hospitals are overwhelmed.  2) Chemtrails are NOT real.  3) Wearing a mask protects others from you.  4) Wearing pants protects others from having to see you without them.  5) Neither are secret plans to control you.

Just spoke with folks at Morris Hospital and the spike of #coronavirus cases is beyond alarming. Many hospitals are already at capacity so please use precautions and be safe. #IL16 https://t.co/TRo20E1QEM
Dear New Congress-members:  if you work out cool.  Please don’t find an excuse to post your entire workout video.    Also Covid is real. https://t.co/iurRXCJvXi

My office is aware of the #COVID19 outbreak at the LaSalle Veterans Home in #IL16 and we will continue to support our VA community keeping the residents and staff in our prayers for a safe and swift recovery.   Full statement here: https://t.co/yO7fKnPu5s

Reminder: the coronavirus pandemic continues to spike here in #Illinois & across the country. In #IL16 counties the number of confirmed #COVID19 cases reached 25k in just six weeks. ‼️ Stay vigilant and stay safe. https://t.co/dxRFh6PfS0

It's our duty to come together & address the urgent needs of those impacted by #COVID19. We've done so many times w/ bipartisan effort. But tonight @SpeakerPelosi chose politics over the American people. I’m disappointed & I’m sure I’m not alone in that. https://t.co/9E2LYD0jKG

It's officially #BackToSchool season & my office has restarted our internship program for the fall semester.   As we all continue to adjust to the challenges of #COVID19 I'm grateful to have our interns--like Tyler here from #IL16--making the most of this remote internship. 👍 https://t.co/9looWHvctA

During this #COVID19 pandemic getting outside has never felt so important to our daily lives & mental health. Our bipartisan efforts to invest in our public lands is critical & long overdue. America is a beautiful country so let’s take care of her. https://t.co/CsiTq0JcXv

Last month Congress passed legislation to extend the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). There's currently $122B left in the fund so if you're in need of this forgivable loan due to #COVID19 visit @SBAgov for more information: https://t.co/6FZQFwc4HK https://t.co/vj4VonPQIG

Had a great time this morning visiting @CrusaderHealth in #IL16 hearing about how they‘ve adjusted so seamlessly to the challenges of #COVID19 & utilized tele-health to better serve patients in our community. Thank you for all the great work you do! https://t.co/iT5bKunMJ8
Color me surprised.    Los Angeles mayor admits protests caused a spike in coronavirus cases https://t.co/QDACnilFzu via @MailOnline

5)  The Guard is not faceless it is made up of people from all backgrounds and careers.   They have been activated for Covid hurricanes counter narcotics etc.  They are well trained and extremely disciplined.

The Communist Party of China has used the #COVID19 pandemic to undermine the whole world & that includes their own people. Reneging their promises to Hong Kong & crushing any chance of independence is how the #CCP authoritarianism works & it's about time we recognize it.

As we continue to fight through the #coronavirus we cannot forget the struggles millions of Americans continue to face with #opioid abuse & misuse. Thank you to the men & women of our emergency services who serve our communities & save countless lives every day. #EMSWeek

We need leadership on how to live AND work in this new normal. @MayoClinic says face masks reduce #COVID19 spread by 50-80% ‼️ Wearing a mask isn’t for you—it protects others from you.  Wearing a mask isn’t about stifling your freedom—it’s about saving lives AND our economy.

This is unacceptable. The Communist Party of China continues to put American lives at risk as they try to capitalize on the #COVID19 pandemic.  With their faulty manufacturing & increased cyber attacks the US needs to hold #China accountable & address their threats head on. https://t.co/Y2y5kbUAIO

To the nurses of #IL16 and all across the country THANK YOU. #ThankYouNurses for the life-saving work you do every single day for the compassion you show to our loved ones for serving on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic. #NationalNursesDay

Many counties across #Illinois continue to report zero cases of #COVID19. As we continue to address areas where numbers are high @GovPritzker must step up & take a regional approach to create a safe reopening plan that balances safety AND employment. https://t.co/1HjxD7qf8x https://t.co/7J6XjRPPu5

This #WorldImmunizationWeek reminds us that we must do more to ensure all people have access to vaccines. The #coronavirus has shown that diseases cross borders & affect everyone. As we await a vaccine we realize the importance of having such life-saving protections. https://t.co/alhP32g44E

Social media is such an important part of our lives especially now with #COVID19. But misinformation & fraudulent activity have become real problems. So today I'm taking action to hold bad actors accountable & make these companies more responsible. https://t.co/xBgVFGWh4B

When the Chinese gov’t tells me they “implemented control measures” does that include the control of information; shutting out reporters & silencing doctors? As the rest of the world works to fight this pandemic China needs to come clean & be honest about the #coronavirus. https://t.co/z8KJRC9WqJ

FEEL GOOD FRIDAY: This week I’m proud to highlight a few Good Samaritans in #IL16 who have stepped up to support those on the front-lines of this #COVID19 pandemic. #InItTogether 👉 Full video here: https://t.co/RMnAFkMxlS https://t.co/n3nRXxLoI6

Economic Impact Payments are going out now & already making a difference. As always please remain vigilant to avoid scams & fraud. Learn more about the financial boost to every American as a result of Congress’s #coronavirus relief #CARESact here: https://t.co/QQgz4fdidl

REMINDER: Today is not *actually* #TaxDay. The @IRSnews  & @USTreasury extended the filing deadline to July 15th to help taxpayers during this #COVID19 pandemic. Federal income tax payments can be deferred without penalties or interest. Get more info👉 https://t.co/1wZSXnJNGQ

Everyone is feeling the impact & uncertainties of the #COVID19 pandemic which can make it hard to find the positives. But the good is out there I promise. So please join me on Facebook in shining a light on the feel-good moments in #IL16. We are all #InItTogether. https://t.co/jGYBLKtZe1

Good news on this #GoodFriday 👉 Starting today @HHSGov will distribute an additional $30 billion in #COVID19 relief funding to healthcare providers from the #CARESact funding. For #Illinois this means over $1.2 million to 12600+ providers. 👍 https://t.co/5f6niHi8w6

The #coronavirus pandemic is compounding on the already inhumane situation in #Syria. The barbaric brutality of Assad must stop & now more than ever the Caesar Syria Civilian Protection Act needs to be enforced for the good of the Syrian people. https://t.co/3GCEnOAXrc

There’s a lot of news & misinformation out there on #COVID19 & it can be really overwhelming. To help I've made a #coronavirus resource page on my website & will continue to share important updates. We are #InItTogether & we WILL get through this. https://t.co/QQgz4fdidl

To the men & women on the front lines of this global health crisis we thank you. #NationalDoctorsDay is a way to share our unwavering gratitude to the medical professionals in #IL16 & across the country who are dedicated to saving lives & fighting #COVID19. #InItTogether https://t.co/krOZvoDhtp

Proud to see the House pass #CARESAct by voice today--a #coronavirus relief effort to save countless lives & our economy. These are trying times but we're #InItTogether & the sacrifices we make now will put us on a stronger path to a brighter future. https://t.co/qlNSZN6zcR

Great phone call with @A_Talakvadze about #Georgia and their fight against #covid19 as well as economic challenges we will all face.  Our friendship and bond remains as strong as ever. https://t.co/3HQZkhflLE
“Do Democrats even care?” That’s a good question @WSJ. Hard to say when you’ve got @SpeakerPelosi holding a bipartisan #COVID19 relief bill as her own political hostage. https://t.co/JKiOcclDZN

The Senate must act on the #CARESAct now. This is not the time for political posturing. This is a time for action. We must protect the critical healthcare infrastructure providing care within our communities including rural areas. #COVID19 https://t.co/kNxXwUhVWw

For more information on this order please visit my website for a FAQs from the Governor's Office. The PDF Fact Sheet can be found under 'Illinois Response' on my 'Coronavirus Information' webpage here: https://t.co/QQgz4fdidl

The spread of the #coronavirus is very serious and it needs to be contained. I know it’s not what we want to do but a shelter in place is what we NEED to do—especially as we learn more about #COVID19. This is the right call folks. Staying home WILL save lives. https://t.co/mR0HNV1cLO

This week I’ve worked with colleagues across the aisle to take action on issues related to #Covid_19: 📝 to @StateDept @USDA on visas for ag workers 📝 for @SBAgov emergency💰 📝 to @HHSGov @GovPritzker on PPE & Medicaid More info on these & others here: https://t.co/QQgz4fdidl

Thank you to all those on the front lines who are working tirelessly—risking their own lives—to keep us stocked safe and healthy - you are critical to our fight against the #coronavirus. #IL16 #InItTogether https://t.co/pCMwNwF5ra

Dec 10: first COVID19 victim Dec 31: Docs post on internet promptly arrested by China. China orders destruction of samples. Jan 21: First mention by China in China Daily newspaper Jan 31: US travel restrictions  For two months #Chinahidthevirus

With schools closed across Illinois due to #coronavirus concerns kids need a creative outlet now more than ever. Starting today my office will be collecting art submissions for the 2020 Congressional Art Competition. More details for #IL16 here: https://t.co/a7JTnIMH8L https://t.co/I7Xdkjq1US

Hearing from folks at home asking about the #coronavirus concerns versus those of the common flu. So I wanted to address that AND encourage folks to take 'social distancing' seriously. #IL16 https://t.co/3aPyAqumyN

Thank you to all who participated in our #IL16 veterans card drive for #StPatricksDay. Due to #coronavirus concerns I will no longer deliver these to the LaSalle Veterans Home directly. Luckily the nurses will still share the cards limericks & well-wishes to our heroes. 🍀 https://t.co/r7Dxbw8lCe
Quick update from here in Washington DC on the latest with #coronavirus information vs misinformation. https://t.co/0UcVzBsOIs

The rapid spread of the #coronavirus needs to be taken seriously & it requires proactive steps to keep the public safe--and that includes my staff & our visitors. We're a strong capable nation & now is the time to take action. My press release here: https://t.co/SOgcGrJZtu

I spoke with #IL16 healthcare providers today about how they’re preparing for the #coronavirus & what steps need to be taken to best care for the community without hospitals being pushed beyond capacity. We'll continue to monitor the situation & work together as this develops. https://t.co/PW4g37Gb83

As we continue to monitor the spread of the #coronavirus information is power--and I want to equip #IL16 with all the tools necessary to keep folks safe. Visit my website for more details--and please remember: this is a time for preparation not panic. https://t.co/QQgz4eVGOL

In the midst of a record-breaking flu season & growing COVID-19 concerns it's increasingly important to ensure our rural hospitals have the capability to care for those who depend on their services. We must act now to save these vital lifelines. #IL16 https://t.co/E8VQH91fKe
